Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: So now all of a sudden she's just your daughter?!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: That's your damn problem, you're too much of a damn worry wart.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Will you shut the fuck up?!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: An hour? Really? I'm not your dumb damn floozy in the street. And you will not talk to me that way.

Speaker: sharonda
Dialogue: I hope you know it doesn't matter to me.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: So whatchu you think? She's cool right?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: This one's just for me and you.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: And she's smart, too. She does poetry, you should hear it. It's like, it's good, you know?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Look, I'm sorry for all the drama.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: What I'm saying is, I probably overreacted.  And then...I don't know. Seeing you two together or whatever. I'm glad to see you're finally happy.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: C'mon man, you know you're my best friend. Nobody's gonna --

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You don't need to say anything. I just wanted to get it off my chest. I'm happy for you, that's all.

Speaker: mika
Dialogue: We goin' to get something to eat?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: That's for later. Bina, nice to meet you.

Speaker: bina
Dialogue: You too. We had fun.  Laura gives Bina a polite hug, pounds Alike on the shoulder and starts to lead Mika away.  MIKA                                 ALIKE Byyeee!!                           Hey hold up!  Laura pumps a lazy    fist in the air in acknowledgement. Bina takes Alike's hand    and slowly drags her away. Alike keeps looking back, then    finally gives up. Laura looks back just as Alike turns around    and disappears around the corner.  BINA  I like your friends. They're cool.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: This is uh... I never... I'm sorry, I'm trippin' out.

Speaker: bina
Dialogue: It's okay. We don't have to.

Speaker: bina
Dialogue: Nothin's wrong, I'm just cleaning up. Don't worry about it.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Look um--I just wanted to say that last night...last night was amazing...thank you for--

Speaker: bina
Dialogue: Last night we were just playin' around, that's all.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Look... We can slow things down... Nobody has to know that we're together.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Huh?! I thought... Look if you don't want to call it that, that's fine, but don't act like nothing happened.

Speaker: bina
Dialogue: Look, I'm not gay okay? This isn't me--I wasn't--I'm not ready for all this...

Speaker: bina
Dialogue: You promise you won't tell anybody?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Where in the hell have you been?!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: LEE--don't you dare--Alike--I am your Mother--

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: You see, that's exactly what I'm talking about?! Get over here!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: No, you come tell your father what you told me!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Don't drag her into this, Audrey!  Go to your room, Alike. Your mom and I are having a discussion.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: We are not discussing!! I wanna know right now--

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Sharonda, wake up!! Come see your father leaving us!!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: I'm not fucking leaving!! Will you stop saying that?!

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Shhh. It's okay. Go in my room and lock the door. Don't come out, `kay?  Sharonda bawls harder. Alike gently closes the door on her.  ALIKE  It's gonna be okay.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Audrey, stop it!! Alike go back to bed!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Meanwhile, your daughter's turning into a damn man right before your very eyes, and you can't even see it!!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: No you take that back.! You shut the fuck up about that, Audrey!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Tell your Dad where you hang out! Tell him about your butch-ass girlfriend--

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: What the hell are you talking about?! You don't know what the hell are you talking about. Alike, please just go to your room, baby!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Tell him you're a dyke! You tell him you're a nasty ass dyke!!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: No she's not gay. Alike we didn't raise you that way, baby.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You shut the hell up Audrey!!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Don't you lie now, you tell the truth!!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: No, I don't know. You tell your mother it's just a phase.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: See, if you would've DONE SOMETHING!!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: This is your fault!! If you had--

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: AUDREY WILL YOU SHUT THE FUCK UP!!!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Say it again! Say it again!

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: I'm a lesbian! Yeah, I'm a dyke.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Don't you say that! Let go! Don't you say that!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: What? You a man now? YOU GON' FIGHT ME LIKE A MAN??!!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: AND YOU TOO! YOU TOO! YOU TOO! OH GOD!!  Tears stream down Arthur's face as Audrey shakes free and aims one last blow at his face.  AUDREY  YOU SAY IT'S NOT TRUE!!!

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Here. Good thing I keep some these around.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Huh-uh. I stopped by the house--I stopped by---

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: That's alright, man. You can wear some of mine. It's okay, c'mon. Lets get some sleep. My sister'll be home in a little bit, too.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: I got this recipe from a magazine. Supposed to be very good. And you see I made those green beans you like. Sharonda pass the rice please.

Speaker: sharonda
Dialogue: Dad. You know where she is.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: I've been accepted into a early college program. Starts in the Spring. Berkeley.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Ten weeks writing boot camp, workshops. Then I can start summer semester.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: We can talk about that. Okay?

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: I need you to meet with my guidance counselor. Sign the paperwork so I can graduate early.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: I'm sorry, alright? I'm sorry I let her hurt you--

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: I need to know now if you'll sign the papers. Yes or no?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You can always come back home. Things are gonna be different, I promise you--

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Dad, I'm not running. I'm choosing.

Speaker: alike
Dialogue: Tell Mom that she was right.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: I just hope you're keeping yourself safe.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You want me to come in with you?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You can always come back home.

Dialogue: Let me get a hug or somethin', damn.
